const_01.question: The 1987 Constitution establishes the Philippines as what kind of State?
Sovereignty resides in the government and all authority emanates from it.
What is the supreme law of the land?
Which article covers the Bill of Rights?
The National Territory includes the Philippine archipelago and all waters embraced therein.
Who is the head of the Executive Department?
How many years is the term of the President?
The Legislative power is vested in the Supreme Court.
Which branch of government has the power to interpret laws?
The Senate and the House of Representatives make up which body?
No person shall be deprived of life, liberty, or property without due process of law.
What right protects citizens against unreasonable searches and seizures?
Which of the following is NOT a branch of the Philippine Government?
The President can be re-elected for a second term immediately.
The introductory part of the Constitution is called the ______.

const_02.question: No person shall be deprived of life, liberty, or property without ______ of law.
The State guarantees full respect for human rights.
What is required for a search warrant to be issued?
The right of the people to be secure in their persons against unreasonable searches and ______.
A law that punishes an act which was not a crime when committed is called a Bill of Attainder.
Which right ensures you can travel or change your home?
Private property shall not be taken for public use without just ______.
The privacy of communication and correspondence shall be inviolable.
No law shall be passed abridging the freedom of ______.
The privilege of the writ of ______ shall not be suspended except in cases of invasion or rebellion.
An accused person is presumed guilty until proven innocent.
What right protects a person from being compelled to be a witness against himself?
No person shall be imprisoned for non-payment of ______ tax.
Involuntary servitude in any form is completely prohibited, even as punishment for a crime.
The right to a speedy, impartial, and public trial belongs to whom?

const_03.question: The Legislative power is vested in the ______ of the Philippines.
How many Senators are elected in the Philippines?
The President is the head of the Judicial Department.
Who has the power to declare the existence of a state of war?
The Executive power is vested in the ______.
The Supreme Court is composed of a Chief Justice and 14 Associate Justices.
The power of the President to reject a bill passed by Congress is called ______.
How many years is the term of a Member of the House of Representatives?
The Vice-President may be appointed as a Member of the Cabinet.
Who is the Commander-in-Chief of all armed forces of the Philippines?
Judicial power includes the duty to settle actual ______ involving rights.
Senators are elected by district, not nationwide.
Which body has the sole power to initiate all cases of impeachment?
The Congress consists of the Senate and the House of ______.
The President can grant pardons and amnesty.

pres_01.question: Who was the first president of the 5th Republic?
Who is known for the 'Philippines 2000' economic program?
Joseph Estrada completed his full 6-year term as President.
Which president is associated with 'Daang Matuwid'?
Who signed the 'Build, Build, Build' infrastructure program?
Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo is an economist by profession.
The campaign slogan of Ferdinand Marcos Jr. was ______.
Who was the president during the 1987 Constitution ratification?
Rodrigo Duterte served as Mayor of Davao City before becoming President.
Joseph Estrada was known for his pro-poor slogan: 'Erap para sa ______'.
Who succeeded Joseph Estrada after the Second EDSA Revolution?
Benigno Aquino III is the son of a former President and a national hero.
Fidel V. Ramos was a former General and Chief of ______ of the AFP.
Which president is known for the 'Strong Republic' nautical highway?
Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is the 17th President of the Philippines.

ra_recent.question: Which Act established the Maharlika Investment Fund?
RA 11934 mandates the registration of ______ cards.
The 'Trabaho Para sa Bayan Act' (RA 11962) focuses on employment generation.
What is the subject of RA 11953?
RA 11960 institutionalizes the 'One Town, One ______' program.
The Cultural Mapping Law (RA 11961) aims to hide Filipino heritage.
RA 11956 extends the amnesty for which type of tax?
RA 11959 establishes Specialty ______ inside DOH hospitals.
The Automatic Income Classification of LGUs Act is RA 11958.
Which law amends the fixed terms of key AFP officers?
The New Agrarian Emancipation Act condones the ______ of farmers.
RA 11934 (SIM Registration) aims to curb cybercrime and text scams.
The Maharlika Investment Fund is the Philippines' first ______ wealth fund.
OTOP stands for One ______, One Product.
RA 11959 restricts healthcare access in regional areas.
